title: Documentation - Wipe out KMS keys
abstract:
# Documentation - Wipe out KMS keys
**Warning:** Deleting keys is a total and complete wipeout. You cannot retrieve your keys after performing the actions on this page.
The Platform Administrator (PA) can delete Key Management System (KMS) keys in the org admin cluster.
The PA can delete the AEAD and Signing keys in the project namespace. See [Supported keys](/distributed-cloud/hosted/docs/latest/gdch/application/ao-user/kms/kms) for the full list of KMS keys.
content:
## Before you begin
Before continuing, ensure you have configured `kubectl` to access the org admin cluster. Follow the steps in [Get a kubeconfig file](/distributed-cloud/hosted/docs/latest/gdch/resources/gdcloud-auth#get-kubeconfig) to use the `gdcloud` command-line interface (CLI).
## Delete all keys
To delete all keys in a project namespace, use the following command:
```
  kubectl --kubeconfig ORG_ADMIN_KUBECONFIG \    delete KEY_PRIMITIVE --namespace=PROJECT --all
```
Replace the following variables:
- : the`kubeconfig`file of the org admin cluster.
- : the keys you want to delete. For example:`aeadkey`for the`AEAD`key.
- with the name of the project. For example:`kms-test1`.
**Note:** To delete keys of all primitive types, ensure to run the command for all possible key primitive types: aeadkey and signingkey.
